member.name: T:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask
member.summary: Compiles VS.NET solutions (or sets of projects), automatically determining project dependencies from inter-project references.

remarks.para: This task support the following projects:
remarks.note: Right now, only Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2002 and 2003 solutions and projects are supported. Support for .NET Compact Framework projects is also not available at this time.
remarks.para: The also supports the model of referencing projects by their output filenames, rather than referencing them inside the solution. It will automatically detect the existance of a file reference and convert it to a project reference. For example, if project "A" references the file in the release output directory of project "B", the will automatically convert this to a project dependency on project "B" and will reference the appropriate configuration output directory at the final build time (ie: reference the debug version of "B" if the solution is built as debug).
remarks.note: The expects all project files to be valid XML files.
remarks.para: When building a project for a down-level target framework, special care should be given to resx files. Resx files (can) contain references to a specific version of CLR types, and as such are only upward compatible.

For example: if you want to be able to build a project both as a .NET 1.0 and .NET 1.1 assembly, the resx files should only contain references to .NET 1.0 CLR types. Failure to do this may result in a failure at runtime on machines with only the .NET Framework 1.0 installed.

example.para: Compiles all of the projects in test.sln, in release mode, in the proper order.
Compiles all of the projects in projects.txt, in the proper order.
Compiles projects A, B and C, using the output of project X as a reference.
Compiles all of the projects in the solution except for project A.

Compiles all of the projects in the solution mapping the specific project at http://localhost/A/A.csproj to c:\inetpub\wwwroot\A\A.csproj and any URLs under http://localhost/B/[remainder] to c:\other\B\[remainder]. This allows the build to work without WebDAV.
example.code: <solution solutionfile="test.sln" configuration="release"> <webmap> <map url="http://localhost/A/A.csproj" path="c:\inetpub\wwwroot\A\A.csproj" /> <map url="http://localhost/B" path="c:\other\B" /> </webmap> </solution>

example.para: Compiles all of the projects in the solution placing compiled outputs in c:\temp.

member.name: M:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.BuildAssemblyFolders
member.summary: Builds the list of folders that should be scanned for assembly references.
member.returns: The list of folders that should be scanned for assembly references.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.Projects
member.summary: The projects to build.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.ReferenceProjects
member.summary: The projects to scan, but not build.
member.remarks: These projects are used to resolve project references and are generally external to the solution being built. References to these project's output files are converted to use the appropriate solution configuration at build time.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.SolutionFile
member.summary: The name of the VS.NET solution file to build.

remarks.para: The can be used instead to supply a list of Visual Studio.NET projects that should be built.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.Configuration
member.summary: The name of the solution configuration to build.

remarks.para: Generally release or debug. Not case-sensitive.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.OutputDir
member.summary: The directory where compiled targets will be placed. This overrides path settings contained in the solution/project.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.WebMaps
member.summary: WebMap of URL's to project references.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.ExcludeProjects
member.summary: Fileset of projects to exclude.

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.AssemblyFolders
member.summary: Set of folders where references are searched when not found in path from project file (HintPath).

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.IncludeVSFolders
member.summary: Includes Visual Studio search folders in reference search path. The default is .

member.name: P:NAnt.VSNet.Tasks.SolutionTask.EnableWebDav
member.summary: Allow the task to use WebDAV for retrieving/compiling the projects within solution. Use of is preferred over WebDAV. The default is .

remarks.para: WebDAV support requires permission changes to be made on your project server. These changes may affect the security of the server and should not be applied to a public installation.
Consult your web server or the NAnt Wiki documentation for more information.

member.name: M:NAnt.VSNet.ProjectReferenceBase.GetAssemblyReferences(NAnt.VSNet.ConfigurationBase)
member.summary: Gets the complete set of assemblies that need to be referenced when a project references this project.
member.param: The project configuration.
member.returns: The complete set of assemblies that need to be referenced when a project references this project.

remarks.para: Apparently, there's some hack in VB.NET that allows a type to be used that derives from a type in an assembly that is not referenced by the project.
When building from the command line (using vbc), the following error is reported "error BC30007: Reference required to assembly 'X' containing the base class 'X'. Add one to your project".
Somehow VB.NET can workaround this issue, without actually adding a reference to that assembly. I verified this with both VS.NET 2003 and VS.NET 2005.
For now, we have no other option than to return all assembly references of the referenced project if the parent is a VB.NET project.

member.name: F:NAnt.VSNet.ProjectFactory._cachedProjects
member.summary: Holds a case-insensitive list of cached projects.
member.remarks: The key of the is the path of the project file (for web projects this can be a URL) and the value is a instance.

member.name: F:NAnt.VSNet.ProjectFactory._cachedProjectGuids
member.summary: Holds a case-insensitive list of cached project GUIDs.
member.remarks: The key of the is the path of the project file (for web projects this can be a URL) and the value is the GUID of the project.

member.name: F:NAnt.VSNet.ProjectFactory._cachedProjectXml
member.summary: Holds a case-insensitive list of cached project GUIDs.
member.remarks: The key of the is the path of the project file (for web projects this can be a URL) and the value is the Xml of the project.
